titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the National Press Company Advertising and Promotional Materials Collection, 1949-1955 and undated RL.00931

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: National Press Company Advertising and Promotional Materials collection
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The National Press Company was a Chicago-based printing and advertising company active in the late 1940s and early 1950s. The company specialized in promotional materials and printed novelties (such as matchbook covers, calendars and postcards) produced for political figures and small businesses. The National Press Company Advertising and Promotional Materials Collection includes promotional pamphlets; brochures of available product lines; order forms; and a handbook for salesmen associated with the National Press Company. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], National Press Company Advertising and Promotional Materials Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The National Press Company Advertising and Promotional Materials Collection was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2010.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions 2010-0070 were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes promotional pamphlets; brochures of available product lines; order form; and a handbook for salesmen associated with the National Press, Inc. company of Chicago, Illinois, and Consolidated-Modern Press, Inc.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: With the exception of the National Salesman's Handbook, items arrived unfoldered, and were grouped and foldered by type and arranged alphabetically.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:

McGraw-Hill Marketing Information Center Vertical File
Outdoor Advertising Association of America (OAAA) Archives
Arlie R. Slabaugh Collection of Direct Mail Literature

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series includes catalogs of advertising specialties, samples and literature from the National Press Co. Contains sample business cards, letterheads, receipt book forms, ticket tags, envelopes, calendar advertising from the Consolidated-Modern Press, Inc. and promotional keychain. Also includes copy of the National Salesman's Handbook, and of the company's publication, National Salesman: a Nation National.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Includes Novelties & Specialties catalog, price list, keychain, and business card]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Includes print advertisements, direct mail, and an issue of National Salesman]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: [Includes business cards, postcards, a 1950 catalog Political Campaign Promotional Printing Advertising Specialties]
